citation.article-title: Hydrogenophaga caeni sp. nov., isolated from activated sludge
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Hydrogenophaga caeni sp. nov.
Hydrogenophaga caeni (ca.e′ni. L. gen. n. caeni of mud, referring to isolation of the type strain from activated sludge).
Colonies on R2A agar are white, glistening, translucent, raised and circular with entire margins.
Growth occurs optimally at 30 °C and pH 7.0–8.0.
On R2A agar at 30 °C, cells are Gram-negative rods (0.8–1.2 μm wide and 1.4–2.0 μm long).
Motile by means of single polar flagella.
Nitrate is reduced to nitrite, but nitrogen gas is not produced.
Thiosulfate is oxidized to sulfate.
No aerobic chemoautotrophic growth occurs with hydrogen as a substrate.
Catalase-positive and oxidase-positive.
Anaerobic growth is observed.
Tween 80 is hydrolysed.
Tyrosine, aesculin, casein, Tween 20, starch, gelatin and urea are not hydrolysed.

Acid is produced from d-raffinose and myo-inositol, but not from d-lactose, d-mannitol, melibiose, d-glucose, sorbitol, sucrose, rhamnose, amygdalin, d-fructose, d-galactose, d-mannose, l-arabinose, arbutin or salicin.

Leucine arylamidase is produced, but esterase (C4), lipase (C14), acid phosphatase, trypsin, α-chymotrypsin, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, cystine arylamidase, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase are not produced.
Weak enzymic activities are observed for alkaline phosphatase and esterase lipase (C8).

The following are utilized (Biolog GN2): Tweens 40 and 80, N-acetyl-d-galactosamine, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, adonitol, α-d-glucose, myo-inositol, α-d-lactose, maltose, l-rhamnose, d-sorbitol, succinic acid monomethyl ester, cis-aconitic acid, formic acid, d-galactonic acid lactone, α-hydroxybutyric acid, β-hydroxybutyric acid, α-ketoglutaric acid, dl-lactic acid, succinic acid, l-alaninamide, d-alanine, l-alanyl glycine, l-asparagine, l-histidine, hydroxy-l-proline, l-proline, l-threonine, γ-aminobutyric acid, phenylethylamine, putrescine and 2,3-butanediol.
Other organic substrates included in Biolog GN2 microplates are not utilized.
Cells contain a large amount of phosphatidylethanolamine and a small amount of diphosphatidylglycerol as the polar lipids.
The major isoprenoid quinone is Q-8.
Major fatty acids are C16 : 0 (27.51 %) and summed feature 3 (C16 : 1ω7c and/or iso-C15 : 0 2-OH, 44.77 %).
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 61.6 mol % (HPLC).
The type strain, EMB71T (=KCTC 12613T=DSM 17962T), was isolated from sludge used for enhanced biological phosphorus removal in a laboratory-scale sequencing batch reactor.
